articles.title: Mini brains reveal clear brain signals of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder
articles.description: Tiny lab-grown brains are offering an unprecedented look at how schizophrenia and bipolar disorder disrupt neural activity. articles.title: Fusion reactors may create dark matter particles
articles.description: Researchers say fusion reactors might do more than generate clean energy—they could also create particles linked to dark matter. articles.title: Losing weight in midlife may have a hidden brain cost
articles.description: Weight loss restored healthy metabolism in both young and mid-aged mice, but the brain told a different story. articles.title: Why your vitamin D supplements might not be working
articles.description: A randomized trial from Vanderbilt-Ingram Cancer Center reveals that magnesium may be the missing key to keeping vitamin D levels in balance. articles.title: U.S. Coast Guard chasing third tanker tied to Venezuela, official says
articles.description: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker accused of helping Venezuela evade U.S. sanctions, as pressure mounts on vessels tied to its shadow fleet.

articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.
